I should have asked to do it without vsync active since it does not make much sense with it.

I've now repeated the checks with vsync disabled in-game, and got the same results.. 25 FPS, regardless of whether "Only Update When Display is visible" was enabled or not.

I couldn't say if the ATI drivers were enforcing vsync anyway.. the Catalyst Control Centre refuses to install on my hardware, so I have no way to check. For what it's worth though, if I set vsync in-game to every second vblank, instead of every vblank, it does horrible things to the screen, so my guess is that disabling it in-game is working correctly.

What can I do with the information this tool displays?

See how much memory KSP is using. If it gets over about 3.4 or so you're in danger of crashing on the next scene change.
